text: Employees were helpful and nice.

name: Barbara Randa
text: Wonderful storr

name: Tammy Cashon
text: Love this shop!

resp.text: Tammy, thank you for your great review! Come back to see us soon. -Lisa V., Owner

name: Mickey Berry
text: This was such a cool place when it was in the old location! It’s ok now, but you used to be able to go in there and find anything and everything!  I think it’s more of a craft store now? The people were nice and the gentleman who helped us was very courteous.  I just didn’t find it to be like it used to be.  We’ll give it another chance!

name: Katrina Gamble Parker
text: Great place to get unique gifts and old fashioned toys for kids!

name: S Taylor
text: I bring my kids up here with me and we love this store. You can find just about anything your creative mind can conjure up.

name: Susan Woods-Ross
text: Always amazing!!! Mary Ann has the God given ability to remember most everyone who has brought their children in by name and watched our children grow up. She is truly one of a kind. We all love her!

name: Claude Freeman
text: Truly a place for a person that has everything- but not a bird whistle, or a bullet box to put remotes in. Did I mention they have seasonal stuff? Great old toys too! Highly recommend this place.

name: Kursten Terrell
text: Been coming here sonce I was a child. This is my happy place!!

name: Izz Noland
text: Great place to get all kinds of old knick knacks. They were the only place around still receiving and selling solar eclipse glasses, and opened days and hours they normally would not.

resp.text: It was truly our pleasure...thank you SO much!

name: Michael Annunziata
text: Lots of cool little things to find here. I always drop by to find stocking stuffers for Christmas

name: LA Huffstutler
text: Great for finding something different and it supported community vendor.

name: Zoe Read
text: Not a good variety store. Lots of unorganized or empty shelves.

name: Kevin Nelson
text: Wonderful store to find hard to find gifts

name: Tania
text: This place is great

name: Jessie Bunton
text: Wide variety of odds and ends, kinda pricey

name: Stuart Jinnette
text: Has a wide varity

name: Jaime Thomas
text:
I would leave zero stars if I could. Will not
Purchase anything from here again. Made an online purchase. Received email about my order and online receipt. Within 24 hours they charged my bank account 4 times. I attempted to call customer service. Can’t get anyone to help. Absolutely ridiculous.

name: Jennifer MacDonald
text: I've shopped here for a few years now...the prices are great & shipping has always been fast and effortless. But lately my orders have taken weeks to process and even longer to receive...usually receiving one item at a time, weeks apart. I've tried emailing customer service but have yet to receive a response either time. Very disappointed with this company lately

name: Michael Yancey
text: Strange my wife said we will not buy any children’s cloths here.  Awful customer service.

name: Victoria Woodyard
text: I visit this location on yesterday and by it being New Year Eve they closed down at 6pm which is understandable but the key holder was very rude and rush my transaction. I ask her a questions on unlinking my coupons from the app bag and she was not for it and when I finally decided to just use the two coupons and remain calm and respectful to the Cashier then she tried to help after I made my purchase which was too late, I just ignored her because I honestly didn’t want any unnecessary problems. She not only took my phone out of my hand to scan the barcode instead of verbally asking me to position it (big no no as if she dropped it, who would pay because I shouldn’t have to) but had to scan it again because she was too busy talking to the other employee. She never told me which card to insert (I was completing a return) nor the total (glad I knew ahead of time). Then she was very disrespectful by ripping the receipt off the register and extended her arm for me to retrieve it as she continued to speak to the other employee never looking my way. Who acts like that and they’re supposed to be in customer service? On top of all that, the line was extremely long and there was no a/c. text: Service is hit or miss. I place a lot of online orders to pick up in store and typically have no issues. Recently tried to pick up two, one of which was in the back. I told the cashier I was picking up two online orders after a purchase. She looked it up, and instead of picking up my items from the cage of online orders in the front, calling someone to grab the one in the back, and having me step to the side for two minutes (as would be common sense), she told me I'd have to go pick them up at customer service, which already had a large line, because she didn't want to hold up the people in line. Thanks to her, I lost about 40 minutes of my life standing in K-Mart.

text: I placed an order online for pickup and upon arrival was confused where to park, there's no phone number to call once parked in Drive-Up parking space. Additionally, my order wasn't at the counter when I got there in spite of the fact I received an email stating that it was hours before. The coffee mugs I ordered were haphazardly placed in a bag with no cushioning and they clanged together all the way back to the car. I am not upset just disappointed and will likely never use Target's ordering anymore. Wal-Mart is much more user-friendly (not an employee of any business).

name: Lynn Drake
text: I'm not usually a Target shopper but was shopping for a family member at this Target, so therefore I don't know the setup.  I did ask many associates to help and the answers I got were "see where that lady is standing as he was pointing down many rows down.  I said yes.  He said look around there". There are many empty shelves.  I did get the last water bottle that I was looking for.  By the way, water bottles are in 3 separate areas of this store.  Why?   I finally went to the cash register where the attendant did take the time to look up the exact place to find my merchandise.  Definitely not a store I would shop at unless it was last store in town.

name: Ashton Taylor
text:
Quality products at a fair price.
However,  the price that rang up was higher than the posted sign.
Discovered the price difference while checking at out at the self checkouts.
Went to service desk for refund of the difference.  While talking to the clerk a manager came up and interrupted my transaction to talk about a different subject to the clerk.  Never even greeted me even though were standing right next to each other.  Price Diff was refunded as a coupon so no take refund.  I asked for the tax as well,   by this time the manager had left so the clerk call her back up.  Again no acknowledgement or apology.  When clerk asked about the tax the manager rolled her eyes.  Told clerk to do it like a coupon refund and left.
Felt like I was bothering the manager.....Well I guess I'll bother another retailer with my money from now on.

name: Adam
text:
I don't normally shop at Target, but I have been looking for a certian item and every store I go to is sold out.
I started doing some online looking and noticed that the item I was looking for is also sold at Target. I went on the Daphne Target website to see if the item I was looking for was in stock. According to the online Target store, there were 4 left, in store and ready for pickup. So I drove down and went inside and started looking. Not being able to find it, I asked an employee about it and he told me that another guy came by the other day looking for the same thing, but they didn't have any. I'm not sure if that he meant there weren't any left or that Target doesn't even carry the item in store.
I advised him that the internet said that there is several of this item in store right now according to the website. He said yea but we don't have it.
The item I was looking for is a $300 Oculus Quest VR headset. I understand if the website said one available, but showing four I didn't call before I drove down there.
Either Target needs to update there website, once in awhile or the employee was lieing. Waste of time out of my day for sure.

name: Mandy Pitts
text:
To Whom It May Concern:
I wanted to write and thank the staff  at my local Target Pharmacy in Daphne, Alabama.  Yesterday, 2/8/14, I showed up at the pharmacy a few minutes after 5pm.  They were closing down for the day, which I was unaware of, but the manager, Marie and the pharmacist agreed to fill my Rx.  They could have easily sent me away, but they  were generous with their time and stayed to help a mom who desperately needed some medicine for a sick child.  Unfortunately, several problems arose due to my child being a new patient, with new insurance.  But they never gave up.  And my child received a much need night of rest.  I wish I had thought to get the young mans name that worked so hard to get this filled, because I would surely like to recognize him personally.  I know working in the service industry can be an often thankless job, so I just want to say thank you to both of them for going above and beyond the normal protocol.
Sincerely,
Julie Pitts
